title: Claude Code Basics Assessment
description: Foundational assessment covering Claude Code CLI tool usage, basic commands, and essential workflows for virtual assistant candidates.

questions.questionText: Which tool should you use to read the contents of a file in Claude Code?
questions.explanation: The Read tool is the dedicated file reading tool in Claude Code. Using Bash with cat is discouraged.

source.title: Claude Code System Prompt - Tool Usage Policy

correctAnswer.quotedText: Avoid using Bash with the find, grep, cat, head, tail, sed, awk, or echo commands... Read files: Use Read (NOT cat/head/tail)

questions.questionText: When you need to make a small change to an existing file, which tool is most appropriate?
options: Create a new file and delete the old one
questions.explanation: Edit tool performs targeted string replacements, preserving the rest of the file. More efficient than rewriting.

correctAnswer.quotedText: Performs exact string replacements in files... Edit files: Use Edit (NOT sed/awk)

questions.questionText: Before using the Edit tool on a file, what must you do first?
options: Nothing, Edit works on any file
Read the file using the Read tool
questions.correctAnswer: Read the file using the Read tool
questions.explanation: Edit tool requires that you've read the file first in the conversation to ensure you know the current contents.

correctAnswer.quotedText: You must use your Read tool at least once in the conversation before editing. This tool will error if you attempt an edit without reading the file.

questions.questionText: What is the correct way to search for files by name pattern in Claude Code?
questions.explanation: Glob tool is the dedicated file pattern matching tool. Avoid using find via Bash.

correctAnswer.quotedText: Fast file pattern matching tool that works with any codebase size... File search: Use Glob (NOT find or ls)

questions.questionText: When searching for text content within files, which tool should you use?
questions.explanation: Grep tool is optimized for content searching with proper permissions. Don't use grep via Bash.

correctAnswer.quotedText: ALWAYS use Grep for search tasks. NEVER invoke grep or rg as a Bash command. The Grep tool has been optimized for correct permissions and access.

questions.questionText: The Bash tool should primarily be used for:
options: Terminal operations like git, npm, docker
questions.correctAnswer: Terminal operations like git, npm, docker
questions.explanation: Bash tool is for actual system commands. File operations have dedicated tools (Read, Write, Edit, Glob, Grep).

correctAnswer.quotedText: IMPORTANT: This tool is for terminal operations like git, npm, docker, etc. DO NOT use it for file operations (reading, writing, editing, searching, finding files) - use the specialized tools for this instead.

questions.questionText: What happens if you try to Edit a file with an old_string that appears multiple times?
options: Only the first occurrence is replaced
The edit fails - old_string must be unique
You're prompted to select which occurrence
questions.correctAnswer: The edit fails - old_string must be unique
questions.explanation: Edit requires unique old_string. Provide more context to make it unique, or use replace_all parameter.

correctAnswer.quotedText: The edit will FAIL if old_string is not unique in the file. Either provide a larger string with more surrounding context to make it unique or use replace_all to change every instance of old_string.

questions.questionText: When creating a new file with the Write tool, what should you verify first?
options: That the file doesn't already exist
questions.explanation: Write overwrites existing files. Always verify the parent directory exists and the file doesn't exist (unless intentional overwrite).

correctAnswer.quotedText: This tool will overwrite the existing file if there is one at the provided path. If this is an existing file, you MUST use the Read tool first to read the file's contents.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the Task tool in Claude Code?
options: Spawning specialized subagents for complex tasks
questions.correctAnswer: Spawning specialized subagents for complex tasks
questions.explanation: Task tool launches specialized agents (Explore, Plan, Bash, etc.) for complex, multi-step operations.

correctAnswer.quotedText: Launch a new agent to handle complex, multi-step tasks autonomously. The Task tool launches specialized agents (subprocesses) that autonomously handle complex tasks.

questions.questionText: When you need to explore a codebase to answer a question (not a specific file lookup), which approach is recommended?
options: Run multiple Glob and Grep commands directly
Ask the user where to look
Read every file in the directory
questions.explanation: For open-ended exploration, the Explore agent is optimized to search across the codebase efficiently.

correctAnswer.quotedText: When exploring the codebase to gather context or to answer a question that is not a needle query for a specific file/class/function, it is CRITICAL that you use the Task tool with subagent_type=Explore instead of running search commands directly.
